cards.name: Port Scanner
cards.flavor: Finding the doors before trying the locks
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Network attacks. Look at the top card of your deck - if it's an Attack card, draw it.

cards.name: Packet Sniffer
cards.flavor: Listening to conversations that weren't meant for you
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Network attacks. Look at defender's hand and choose 1 card for them to reveal to you.

cards.name: Log4Shell
cards.description: Remote code execution in Java logging
cards.flavor: One line of code that shook the internet
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Network attacks. If target infrastructure is adjacent to another infrastructure, that adjacent infrastructure becomes vulnerable to any attack vector.

cards.name: SQL Injection Scanner
cards.flavor: Your browser is now mine
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Web attacks.

cards.name: Cross-Site Scripting
cards.flavor: Making websites say things they never meant to say
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Web attacks.

cards.name: Phishing Campaign
cards.description: Creates fake login pages to steal credentials
cards.flavor: It looks just like the real thing...
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Social Engineering attacks. Force defender to discard 1 random card.

cards.name: Pretexting Call
cards.description: Gains access through help desk social engineering
cards.flavor: Hi, I'm from IT. I need your password to fix your account.
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Social Engineering attacks.

cards.name: Trojan Dropper
cards.description: Delivers malicious payload disguised as legitimate software
cards.flavor: The gift horse nobody checked the mouth of
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Malware attacks. This exploit cannot be blocked by reactive cards.

cards.name: Macro Virus
cards.flavor: Please find the attached invoice
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure card. It becomes vulnerable to Malware attacks.

cards.name: DDoS Attack
cards.description: Floods target with traffic to disrupt service
cards.flavor: Like trying to enter a stadium where all seats are taken by ghosts
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure with a Network exploit. It becomes compromised. All other Network infrastructure becomes vulnerable to Network attacks for 1 turn.

cards.name: Man-in-the-Middle
cards.flavor: I'm not a man or a middle, I'm the man in the middle
cards.effect: Target 1 vulnerable infrastructure. It becomes compromised. Look at defender's hand and choose 1 card for them to discard.

cards.name: SQL Injection Attack
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure with a Web exploit. It becomes compromised.

cards.name: Credential Stuffing
cards.description: Uses stolen credentials to gain unauthorized access
cards.flavor: One password to rule them all, and in the darkness bind them
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure with a Web exploit. It becomes compromised.

cards.name: Spear Phishing Attack
cards.flavor: The CEO would like you to wire $10,000 immediately
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure with a Social exploit. It becomes compromised.

cards.name: Baiting Attack
cards.description: Uses physical media to spread malware
cards.flavor: Free USB drives in the parking lot!
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure with a Social exploit. It becomes compromised.

cards.name: Ransomware Deployment
cards.flavor: Your files are now our files. Want them back?
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure with a Malware exploit. It becomes compromised.

cards.name: Keylogger Installation
cards.flavor: Every key you press is a secret you share
cards.effect: Target 1 infrastructure with a Malware exploit. It becomes compromised.

cards.name: Security Service Terminator
cards.flavor: Security software can't protect what it can't see
cards.effect: REACTIVE MODE: Cancel a Shield card being played on infrastructure. ACTIVE MODE: Remove all Network shields from target infrastructure and gain 1 AP.

cards.name: Anti-Forensics Toolkit
cards.flavor: Like sweeping footprints from the sand
cards.effect: Cancel a Fortify card being played on infrastructure.

cards.name: WAF Bypasser
cards.flavor: Finding the holes in the safety net
cards.effect: Cancel a Shield card being played on infrastructure.

cards.name: Supply Chain Compromise
cards.flavor: Why break down the front door when you can walk in with the mail?
cards.effect: Cancel a Fortify card being played on infrastructure.

cards.name: Social Engineer
cards.flavor: The most sophisticated firewalls can be bypassed with a simple phone call
cards.effect: Cancel a Shield card being played on infrastructure.

cards.name: Deepfake Caller
cards.description: Uses AI-generated voice to impersonate executives
cards.flavor: Your CEO just called - except it wasn't really them
cards.effect: Cancel a Fortify card being played on infrastructure.

cards.name: Polymorphic Code
cards.flavor: A virus that changes its face every time you look
cards.effect: Cancel a Shield card being played on infrastructure.

cards.name: Zero-Day Exploit
cards.flavor: The flaw no one knows about yet
cards.effect: Cancel a Fortify card being played on infrastructure.

cards.name: Advanced Persistent Threat
cards.flavor: We've been in your network longer than most of your employees
cards.effect: Can be played as any Exploit or Attack card. Target infrastructure can't be protected by reactive cards for 1 turn.

cards.name: Living Off The Land
cards.description: Uses legitimate system tools for attacks
cards.flavor: Why bring your own weapons when the target provides them?
cards.effect: Can be played as any Exploit, Attack, or Counter-Attack card. FREE when targeting User Systems infrastructure (Employee Workstations).

cards.name: Lateral Movement
cards.flavor: Why settle for one system when you can have them all?
cards.effect: After compromising infrastructure, immediately make another infrastructure vulnerable without playing an Exploit card.

cards.name: Privilege Escalation
cards.description: Increases access rights on compromised systems
cards.flavor: From user to admin in five easy steps
cards.effect: Can be played as any Attack card. The targeted infrastructure cannot be restored by Response cards for 1 turn.

cards.name: Multi-Stage Malware
cards.flavor: It's not just what it does now, but what it will do next
cards.effect: Can be played as any Exploit card. If the infrastructure becomes compromised, gain 1 AP.

cards.name: AI-Powered Attack
cards.description: Uses machine learning to optimize attacks
cards.flavor: The attack that learns as it goes
cards.effect: Can be played as any card type. Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and place one in your hand.

cards.name: Memory Corruption Attack
cards.description: Corrupts system memory causing complete data loss
cards.flavor: When you can't steal the data, make sure no one else can use it either
cards.effect: The defender must discard their entire hand and draw the same number of cards from their deck.

cards.name: Exploit Chaining Framework
cards.description: Links multiple vulnerabilities into devastating attack chains
cards.flavor: One vulnerability leads to another, and another...
cards.effect: Apply 2 different attack vector exploits to the same infrastructure simultaneously. If it becomes compromised, immediately make an adjacent infrastructure vulnerable.

cards.name: Shield Overload Generator
cards.description: Overwhelms defensive systems with rapid attacks
cards.flavor: Even the strongest shields have breaking points
cards.effect: Reactive: When defender plays a shield card, force them to discard 2 cards. If they can't, the shield effect is cancelled and infrastructure becomes vulnerable.

cards.name: Dependency Mapper
cards.flavor: Understanding the web of connections before pulling the strings
cards.effect: Target infrastructure becomes vulnerable to ALL attack vectors. Additionally, look at defender's hand and choose 1 card for them to discard.

cards.name: Redundancy Killer
cards.flavor: Why hit one system when you can hit all its backups too?
cards.effect: Attack vulnerable infrastructure. If successful, remove all shields from 2 other infrastructure and prevent them from being shielded for 2 turns.

cards.name: Cascading System Failure
cards.flavor: When one falls, they all fall
cards.effect: Compromise target vulnerable infrastructure. For each infrastructure you control, make 1 random secure infrastructure vulnerable. Cannot be countered by reactive cards.

cards.name: State Confusion Attack
cards.flavor: Making systems forget what they're supposed to be protecting
cards.effect: Choose any infrastructure. Reset its state to secure, then immediately apply 2 random exploits to it. Defender cannot play reactive cards during this process.

cards.name: Shield Destroyer
cards.flavor: Every wall can be broken with the right hammer
cards.effect: Attack target shielded infrastructure. Additionally, remove all shields from this infrastructure.

cards.name: Defense Bypass
cards.flavor: Why break down the door when you can walk through the wall?
cards.effect: Cancel target shield card. Additionally, draw 1 card.

cards.name: Vulnerability Scanner
cards.flavor: Know thy enemy's weaknesses
cards.effect: Make target infrastructure vulnerable. Additionally, look at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Emergency Breach
cards.description: Rapid exploitation when systems are overwhelmed
cards.flavor: Strike when defenses are spread thin
cards.effect: Make target infrastructure vulnerable. Cost is reduced by 1 for each shielded infrastructure opponent controls.
